{"step_by_step_thinking": "The presence of an increased number of CGG trinucleotide repeats suggests a diagnosis of fragile X syndrome. Fragile X syndrome is an X-linked disorder characterized by intellectual disability, behavioral problems, and physical features. The physical features commonly seen in individuals with fragile X syndrome include a long face, large everted ears, and macroorchidism (enlarged testicles). Therefore, the most likely findings on physical examination of this patient would be a long face and large everted ears.", "answer_choice": "B"}
